detail.title: Gesture Details
detail.selectHint: Select a gesture on the left to see detailed information.

caution.title: Notes
items: Recognition accuracy may drop in low light.
Keep your hand within the camera frame.
Perform motions slowly and with larger movements.
For two-hand gestures, both hands must be visible on the screen at the same time.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Face your palm toward the camera
Move slowly around the center of the frame
tips: Keeping your hand too close may cause jitter.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may jump or stop.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch firmly with your thumb and index finger
Hold to keep pressed and move to drag
tips: A very small pinch may be weakly recognized.
For dragging, hold steadily and move slowly.
pitfalls: If short vs. long feels confusing, try holding for about 0.5 seconds before releasing.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers into a V shape
Keep your palm facing the camera
tips: A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap or the angle is too narrow, recognition may be unstable.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM + FIST
gestures.trigger: One hand OPEN_PALM + the other hand FIST
howTo: Keep both hands visible in the frame
Scroll by moving your hand up/down
tips: Small, continuous movements work best while scrolling.
pitfalls: If one hand leaves the frame, scrolling may stop.

gestures.name: FIST (HOLD)
howTo: Hold a fist for a set duration
Release your hand after it toggles
pitfalls: If you hold a fist too often/too long, it may toggle unexpectedly.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Make a fist once to toggle
Release your hand after toggling
tips: Toggle gestures can misfire—perform it slowly and only once.
pitfalls: If a fist is detected repeatedly, it may toggle multiple times.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm and move
Move slowly if the line jitters
tips: In Draw mode, cursor movement equals pen position.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the position may jump.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch to pen down (draw)
Release to pen up (stop)
tips: If lines break, try holding the pinch a bit more firmly.
pitfalls: If the pinch is weak, pen-down may become unstable.

gestures.name: TWO OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open both hands and keep them in the frame
Hold briefly, then perform
tips: Both hands must be recognized at the same time.
pitfalls: If one hand appears late, recognition may fail.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Perform a short pinch once
tips: To advance multiple slides, repeat slowly with a steady rhythm.
pitfalls: Holding the pinch too long may cause unintended behavior.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Form a clear V and perform once
tips: A wider V angle improves stability.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap, recognition may be unstable.

gestures.name: TWO FIST
howTo: Make fists with both hands at the same time
tips: Useful for moving focus across links/buttons/shapes.
pitfalls: If timing differs between hands, recognition may fail.

gestures.name: LEFT FIST + RIGHT PINCH
gestures.trigger: Left hand FIST + right hand PINCH
howTo: Hold a fist with your left hand
Perform a single pinch with your right hand
pitfalls: If hands are swapped, it may be recognized as a different gesture.

gestures.name: TWO PINCH
howTo: Perform pinches with both hands simultaneously
tips: Exit can be disruptive—perform it slowly and deliberately.
pitfalls: If only one hand pinches, recognition may fail.

gestures.name: TWO V
howTo: Form V signs with both hands
Hold briefly, then release
tips: Use this when you need to switch modes.
pitfalls: If the V shape is weak, it may be mistaken for a normal hand pose.
